diff --git a/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/checks/whitespace/NoLineWrapCheck.java b/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/checks/whitespace/NoLineWrapCheck.java index 412dec0b8..a3daa1f71 100644 --- a/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/checks/whitespace/NoLineWrapCheck.java +++ b/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/checks/whitespace/NoLineWrapCheck.java @@ -67,7 +67,7 @@ import com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.utils.TokenUtil; * Examples: *

- * package com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle. //violation

  *   checks.whitespace;
  *
  * import java.lang.Object; // OK

timeline.bodyText:
Acceptable tokens for this check are
IMPORT, STATIC_IMPORT, PACKAGE_DEF, CLASS_DEF, METHOD_DEF, CTOR_DEF, ENUM_DEF, INTERFACE_DEF.
Please add example for some extended tokens, e.g. for CLASS_DEF and CTOR_DEF
timeline.author: strkkk
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -73,6 +95,20 @@ * <property name="tokens" value="IMPORT"/> * </module> * + *

+ * Example: + *

+ * 
+ * package com.puppycrawl. // OK
+ * tools.checkstyle.checks;
+ *
+ * import java.io.*; // OK
+ * import java.lang. // violation
+ *  Boolean;
+ *
+ * import static java.math. // OK
+ * BigInteger.ZERO;
+ *

timeline.bodyText: Example for class can include method_def and ctor_def as well
timeline.author: strkkk
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -73,6 +95,129 @@ * <property name="tokens" value="IMPORT"/> * </module> * + *

+ * Example: + *

+ * 
+ * package com.puppycrawl. // OK
+ * tools.checkstyle.checks;
+ *
+ * import java.io.*; // OK
+ * import java.lang. // violation
+ *  Boolean;
+ *
+ * import static java.math. // OK
+ * BigInteger.ZERO;
+ *
+ * + *

+ * To configure the check to force no line-wrapping only + * in class definitions: + *

+ * 
+ * <module name="NoLineWrap">
+ *   <property name="tokens" value="CLASS_DEF"/>

replies.bodyText: should i remove dedicated examples of METHOD_DEF and CTOR_DEF in that case or let them be?
replies.author: sulkykookie

replies.bodyText:
Yes.
I think it can be one example for class_def, method_def and ctor_def, no need for interface and enum
replies.author: strkkk
